Nodes.Text: Transactions
An instance of the `TransactionsApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.
transactions_api = client.transactions

Nodes.Title: Get-Transactions
Nodes.Name: get_transactions
Nodes.Description:
The transactions API allows you to retrieve transaction history of consumer-permissioned accounts.

> 🛑
> 
> The *id_token* should be used as the bearer token with this call.

For more information on how to paginate transaction results, please see: [Pagination](https://docs.akoya.com/v2/docs/pagination)

Use the `mode` query param to receive FDX-aligned, standardized data values (Beta). For example:

`https://sandbox-products.ddp.akoya.com/transactions/v2/mikomo?mode=standard`

`mode` is available in both sandbox and production.

`mode` is supported by a subset of providers. Log into the [Data Recipient Hub](https://recipient.ddp.akoya.com/login) and click [here](https://recipient.ddp.akoya.com/support/article/kA0Uw00000015GzKAI) to view a list of all providers supporting the `mode` parameter.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an instance of [```PagedIterable```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/PagedIterable), where each item is of type ```Any``` and each page is of type [```TransactionsEntity```]($m/Transactions%20Entity).

MethodSignature.Text:
def get_transactions(self,
                    version,
                    provider_id,
                    account_id,
                    start_time=None,
                    end_time=None,
                    offset='0',
                    limit=50,
                    x_akoya_interaction_type=None,
                    mode=None)

Parameters.Name: version
Parameters.Description: Akoya major version number. Do not use minor version numbers. For instance, use v2 and not v2.2

Parameters.Name: provider_id
Parameters.Description: Id of provider

Parameters.Name: account_id
Parameters.Description: Account Identifier

Parameters.Name: start_time
Parameters.Description: ISO 8601 date format in UTC time zone. If blank, the default value (current date - 15 calendar days) is used. If a value is specified, endTime is required.

Parameters.Name: end_time
Parameters.Description: ISO 8601 date format in UTC time zone. If blank, the default value (current date) is used. If a value is specified, startTime is required.

Parameters.Name: offset
Parameters.Description:
The number of items to skip before the first in the response. The default is 0.

**Default**: `'0'`

Parameters.Name: limit
Parameters.Description:
The maximum number of items to be returned in the response. The default is 50.

**Default**: `50`

Parameters.Name: x_akoya_interaction_type
Parameters.Description:
Optional but recommended header to include with each data request. 
Allowed values are `user` or `batch`. 
`user` indicates a request is prompted by an end-user action.
`batch` indicates the request is part of a batch process.

Parameters.Name: mode
Parameters.Description: BETA. Default is raw. Use standard for FDX-aligned, standardized data values.

Errors.Name: ErrorException
Errors.Description: 701 - Tax Lots not found. The `holdingId` may be wrong.

Errors.Name: ErrorException
Errors.Description: Request timed out (round trip call took >10 seconds).

Errors.Name: ErrorException
Errors.Description: FdxVersion in header is not implemented.

version.description: Akoya major version number. Do not use minor version numbers. For instance, use v2 and not v2.2; Default: v2

accountId.description: Account Identifier; Default: :accountId

startTime.description: ISO 8601 date format in UTC time zone. If blank, the default value (current date - 15 calendar days) is used. If a value is specified, endTime is required.

endTime.description: ISO 8601 date format in UTC time zone. If blank, the default value (current date) is used. If a value is specified, startTime is required.

offset.description: The number of items to skip before the first in the response. The default is 0.; Default: 0

limit.description: The maximum number of items to be returned in the response. The default is 50.; Default: 50

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent identity of the account. Not an account number. This identity must be unique to the owning institution.

Fields.Name: account_type
Fields.Description: The type of an account. For instance, CHECKING, SAVINGS, 401K, etc.

Fields.Name: account_number_display
Fields.Description: Account display number for the end user’s handle at owning institution. This is to be displayed by the Interface Provider.

Fields.Name: currency
Fields.Description: Indicates the currency code used by the account. May also include currency rate.

Fields.Name: nickname
Fields.Description: Name given by the user. Used in UIs to assist in account selection

Fields.Name: product_name
Fields.Description: Marketed product name for this account.  Used in UIs to assist in account selection

Fields.Name: status
Fields.Description: The status of an account.

Fields.Name: line_of_business
Fields.Description: The line of business, such as consumer, consumer joint, small business, corporate, etc.

Fields.Name: balance_type
Fields.Description: ASSET (positive transaction amount increases balance), LIABILITY (positive transaction amount decreases balance)

Fields.Name: interest_rate
Fields.Description: Interest Rate of Account

Fields.Name: interest_rate_type
Fields.Description: The type of interest rate. FIXED or VARIABLE.

Fields.Name: interest_rate_as_of
Fields.Description: Date of account’s interest rate

Fields.Name: last_activity_date
Fields.Description: Date that last transaction occurred on account

Fields.Name: micr_number
Fields.Description: MICR Number

Fields.Name: parent_account_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent identity of the parent account. This is used to group accounts.

Fields.Name: prior_interest_rate
Fields.Description: Previous Interest Rate of Account

Fields.Name: transfer_in
Fields.Description: Account is eligible for incoming transfers

Fields.Name: transfer_out
Fields.Description: Account is eligible for outgoing transfers

Fields.Name: tax_year
Fields.Description:
Year for which taxes are being paid

**Constraints**: `>= 2018`, `<= 2050`

Fields.Name: corrected
Fields.Description: True to indicate this is a corrected tax form

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent identity of the source account. Not the account number

Fields.Name: tax_form_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent id for this tax form. Depending upon the data provider, this may be the same id as the enclosing tax statement id, or this may be a different id, or this id may be omitted.

Fields.Name: tax_form_date
Fields.Description: Date of production or delivery of the tax form

Fields.Name: additional_information
Fields.Description: Additional explanation text or content about this tax form

Fields.Name: tax_form_type
Fields.Description: Enumerated name of the tax form entity e.g. "TaxW2"

Fields.Name: issuer
Fields.Description: Issuer's name, address, phone, and TIN. Issuer data need only be transmitted on enclosing TaxStatement, if it is the same on all its included tax forms.

Fields.Name: recipient
Fields.Description: Recipient's name, address, phone, and TIN. Recipient data need only be transmitted on enclosing TaxStatement, if it is the same on all its included tax forms.

Fields.Name: attributes
Fields.Description: Additional attributes for this tax form when defined fields are not available. Some specific additional attributes already defined by providers: Fields required by [IRS FIRE](https://www.irs.gov/e-file-providers/filing-information-returns-electronically-fire): Name Control, Type of Identification Number (EIN, SSN, ITIN, ATIN). (ATIN is tax ID number for pending adoptions.) Tax form provider field for taxpayer notification: Recipient Email Address.

Fields.Name: error
Fields.Description: Present if an error was encountered while retrieving this form

Fields.Name: links
Fields.Description: Links to retrieve this form as data or image, or to invoke other APIs

Nodes.Title: Deposit Balances
Nodes.Name: DepositBalances
Nodes.Description:
Data elements included with balances specific to deposit accounts

*This model accepts additional fields of type Any.*

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Corresponds to AccountId in Account

Fields.Name: amount
Fields.Description:
The amount of money in the account currency.

If balanceType is `ASSET`:

  1. If `debitCreditMemo` = `DEBIT`, sign is "+" or not present
  2. If `CREDIT`, sign is "-"

If balanceType is `LIABILITY`:

  1. If `debitCreditMemo` = `DEBIT`, sign is "-"
  2. If `CREDIT`, sign is "+" or not present

Fields.Name: category
Fields.Description: Transaction category, preferably MCC or SIC.

Fields.Name: debit_credit_memo
Fields.Description: Akoya will ensure that this is correctly populated with one of DEBIT or CREDIT and matches the sign of the status field.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: The description of the transaction

Fields.Name: image_ids
Fields.Description: Array of image identifiers (unique to transaction) used to retrieve images of check or transaction receipt.

Fields.Name: fi_attributes
Fields.Description:
Array of FI-specific attributes

**Constraints**: *Minimum Items*: `1`, *Unique Items Required*

Fields.Name: foreign_amount
Fields.Description: The amount of money in the foreign currency

Fields.Name: foreign_currency
Fields.Description: The ISO 4217 code of the foreign currency

Fields.Name: line_item
Fields.Description: Breakdown of the transaction details

Fields.Name: links
Fields.Description: Links (unique to this Transaction) used to retrieve images of checks or transaction receipts, or invoke other APIs

Fields.Name: memo
Fields.Description: Secondary transaction description

Fields.Name: posted_timestamp
Fields.Description: The date and time that the transaction was posted to the account. If not provided then TransactionTimestamp can be used as PostedTimeStamp.

Fields.Name: reference
Fields.Description: A tracking reference identifier

Fields.Name: reference_transaction_id
Fields.Description:
Akoya ensures that this field is populated for all transactions which are reversals, otherwise it is null. Either way it is always present.

For reverse postings, the identity of the transaction being reversed. For the correction transaction, the identity of the reversing post. For credit card posting transactions, the identity of the authorization transaction.

Fields.Name: status
Fields.Description: AUTHORIZATION, MEMO, PENDING, or POSTED

Fields.Name: sub_category
Fields.Description: Transaction category detail

Fields.Name: transaction_id
Fields.Description:
Long term persistent identity of the transaction (unique to account). 
Transaction IDs should: 

  1. be the same for pending and posted 
  2. be different for reversed transactions 
  3. `referenceTransactionId` should be present for reversed transactions'

Fields.Name: transaction_timestamp
Fields.Description:
The date and time that the transaction was added to the server backend systems.

Akoya ensures that this field is populated for all transactions to which it applies, otherwise it is null. Either way it is always present.

Fields.Name: payee
Fields.Description: Payee name

Fields.Name: check_number
Fields.Description: Check Number

Fields.Name: transaction_type
Fields.Description: DepositTransaction Type

Nodes.Title: Form 1042 -S Agent
Nodes.Name: Form1042SAgent
Nodes.Description:
One of various persons or businesses involved in Form 1042-S reporting. Use
  * `tin` for
    * Box 12a, Withholding Agent EIN,
    * Box 13e, Recipient U.S. TIN,
    * Box 14b, Primary Withholding Agent EIN,
    * Box 15a, Intermediary or flow-through entity EIN,
    * Box 16b, Payer TIN
  * `individualName` or `businessName` for
    * Box 12d, Withholding Agent name,
    * Box 13a, Recipient name,
    * Box 14a, Primary Withholding Agent name,
    * Box 15d, Intermediary or flow-through entity name,
    * Box 16a, Payer name
  * `address.country` for
    * Box 12f, Withholding Agent Country code,
    * Box 13b, Recipient Country code,
    * Box 15f, Intermediary or flow-through entity Country code
  * `address` for
    * Boxes 12h-i, Withholding Agent Address,
    * Boxes 13c-d, Recipient Address,
    * Boxes 15h-i, Intermediary or flow-through entity Address

Nodes.Title: Insurance Balances
Nodes.Name: InsuranceBalances
Nodes.Description:
Data elements included with balances specific to insurance accounts

*This model accepts additional fields of type Any.*

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Corresponds to AccountId in Account

Fields.Name: amount
Fields.Description:
The amount of money in the account currency.

If balanceType is `ASSET`:

  1. If `debitCreditMemo` = `DEBIT`, sign is "+" or not present
  2. If `CREDIT`, sign is "-"

If balanceType is `LIABILITY`:

  1. If `debitCreditMemo` = `DEBIT`, sign is "-"
  2. If `CREDIT`, sign is "+" or not present

Fields.Name: category
Fields.Description: Transaction category, preferably MCC or SIC.

Fields.Name: debit_credit_memo
Fields.Description: Akoya will ensure that this is correctly populated with one of DEBIT or CREDIT and matches the sign of the status field.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: The description of the transaction

Fields.Name: image_ids
Fields.Description: Array of image identifiers (unique to transaction) used to retrieve images of check or transaction receipt.

Fields.Name: fi_attributes
Fields.Description:
Array of FI-specific attributes

**Constraints**: *Minimum Items*: `1`, *Unique Items Required*

Fields.Name: foreign_amount
Fields.Description: The amount of money in the foreign currency

Fields.Name: foreign_currency
Fields.Description: The ISO 4217 code of the foreign currency

Fields.Name: line_item
Fields.Description: Breakdown of the transaction details

Fields.Name: links
Fields.Description: Links (unique to this Transaction) used to retrieve images of checks or transaction receipts, or invoke other APIs

Fields.Name: memo
Fields.Description: Secondary transaction description

Fields.Name: posted_timestamp
Fields.Description: The date and time that the transaction was posted to the account. If not provided then TransactionTimestamp can be used as PostedTimeStamp.

Fields.Name: reference
Fields.Description: A tracking reference identifier

Fields.Name: reference_transaction_id
Fields.Description:
Akoya ensures that this field is populated for all transactions which are reversals, otherwise it is null. Either way it is always present.

For reverse postings, the identity of the transaction being reversed. For the correction transaction, the identity of the reversing post. For credit card posting transactions, the identity of the authorization transaction.

Fields.Name: status
Fields.Description: AUTHORIZATION, MEMO, PENDING, or POSTED

Fields.Name: sub_category
Fields.Description: Transaction category detail

Fields.Name: transaction_id
Fields.Description:
Long term persistent identity of the transaction (unique to account). 
Transaction IDs should: 

  1. be the same for pending and posted 
  2. be different for reversed transactions 
  3. `referenceTransactionId` should be present for reversed transactions'

Fields.Name: transaction_timestamp
Fields.Description:
The date and time that the transaction was added to the server backend systems.

Akoya ensures that this field is populated for all transactions to which it applies, otherwise it is null. Either way it is always present.

Fields.Name: transaction_type
Fields.Description: InsuranceTransaction Type

Fields.Description: Source of money.

Fields.Description: Load on the transaction.

Fields.Description: For 401k accounts only. This indicates the transaction was due to a loan or a loan repayment.

Fields.Description: How much loan pre-payment is interest.

Fields.Description: How much loan pre-payment is principal.

Fields.Description: Number of shares before split.

Fields.Name: payroll_date

Fields.Name: penalty
Fields.Description: Indicates amount withheld due to a penalty.

Fields.Name: price
Fields.Description: Unit purchase price.

Fields.Name: prior_year_contrib
Fields.Description: Indicates this buy was made using prior years contribution. TRUE or FALSE.

Fields.Name: running_balance
Fields.Description: Running balance of the position.

Fields.Name: security_id
Fields.Description: Unique identifier of security.

Fields.Name: security_id_type
Fields.Description: Security identifier type.

Fields.Name: shares
Fields.Description: Number of shares (with decimals). Negative numbers indicate securities are being removed from the account.

Fields.Name: split_ratio_denominator
Fields.Description: Split ratio denominator.

Fields.Name: split_ratio_numerator
Fields.Description: Split ratio numerator.

Fields.Name: state_withholding
Fields.Description: State tax withholding.

Fields.Name: sub_account_fund
Fields.Description: From which account money came in.

Fields.Name: sub_account_sec
Fields.Description: Sub-account security type.

Fields.Name: symbol
Fields.Description: Ticker symbol.

Fields.Name: taxes
Fields.Description: Taxes on the trade.

Fields.Name: tax_exempt
Fields.Description: Tax-exempt transaction TRUE or FALSE.

Fields.Name: transaction_reason
Fields.Description: Reason for this transaction; CALL (the debt was called), SELL (the debt was sold), MATURITY (the debt reached maturity)

Fields.Name: transaction_type
Fields.Description: InvestmentTransaction Type

Fields.Name: transfer_action
Fields.Description: Transfer direction.

Fields.Name: unit_price
Fields.Description: Price per commonly-quoted unit. Does not include markup/markdown, unitprice. Share price for stocks, mutual funds, and others. Percentage of par for bonds. Per share (not contract) for options.

Fields.Name: units
Fields.Description: For security-based actions other than stock splits, quantity. Shares for stocks, mutual funds, and others. Face value for bonds. Contracts for options.

Fields.Name: withholding
Fields.Description: Federal tax withholding.

Fields.Description: Name given by the user. Used in UIs to assist in account selection

Fields.Description: Marketed product name for this account.  Used in UIs to assist in account selection

Fields.Description: The status of an account.

Fields.Description: The line of business, such as consumer, consumer joint, small business, corporate, etc.

Fields.Name: balance_type
Fields.Description: ASSET (positive transaction amount increases balance), LIABILITY (positive transaction amount decreases balance)

Fields.Name: interest_rate
Fields.Description: Interest Rate of Account

Fields.Name: interest_rate_type
Fields.Description: The type of interest rate. FIXED or VARIABLE.

Fields.Name: interest_rate_as_of
Fields.Description: Date of account’s interest rate

Fields.Name: last_activity_date
Fields.Description: Date that last transaction occurred on account

Fields.Name: micr_number
Fields.Description: MICR Number

Fields.Name: parent_account_id

Fields.Name: prior_interest_rate

Fields.Name: transfer_in

Fields.Description: Term of loan in months

Fields.Name: maturity_date
Fields.Description: Maturity date

Fields.Description: Loan origination date

Fields.Description: Total number of payments

Nodes.Title: Loan Balances
Nodes.Name: LoanBalances
Nodes.Description:
Data elements included with balances specific to loan accounts

*This model accepts additional fields of type Any.*

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Corresponds to AccountId in Account

Fields.Name: amount
Fields.Description:
The amount of money in the account currency.

If balanceType is `ASSET`:

  1. If `debitCreditMemo` = `DEBIT`, sign is "+" or not present
  2. If `CREDIT`, sign is "-"

If balanceType is `LIABILITY`:

  1. If `debitCreditMemo` = `DEBIT`, sign is "-"
  2. If `CREDIT`, sign is "+" or not present

Fields.Name: category
Fields.Description: Transaction category, preferably MCC or SIC.

Fields.Name: debit_credit_memo
Fields.Description: Akoya will ensure that this is correctly populated with one of DEBIT or CREDIT and matches the sign of the status field.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: The description of the transaction

Fields.Name: image_ids
Fields.Description: Array of image identifiers (unique to transaction) used to retrieve images of check or transaction receipt.

Fields.Name: fi_attributes
Fields.Description:
Array of FI-specific attributes

**Constraints**: *Minimum Items*: `1`, *Unique Items Required*

Fields.Name: foreign_amount
Fields.Description: The amount of money in the foreign currency

Fields.Name: foreign_currency
Fields.Description: The ISO 4217 code of the foreign currency

Fields.Name: line_item
Fields.Description: Breakdown of the transaction details

Fields.Name: links
Fields.Description: Links (unique to this Transaction) used to retrieve images of checks or transaction receipts, or invoke other APIs

Fields.Name: memo
Fields.Description: Secondary transaction description

Fields.Name: posted_timestamp
Fields.Description: The date and time that the transaction was posted to the account. If not provided then TransactionTimestamp can be used as PostedTimeStamp.

Fields.Name: reference
Fields.Description: A tracking reference identifier

Fields.Name: reference_transaction_id
Fields.Description:
Akoya ensures that this field is populated for all transactions which are reversals, otherwise it is null. Either way it is always present.

For reverse postings, the identity of the transaction being reversed. For the correction transaction, the identity of the reversing post. For credit card posting transactions, the identity of the authorization transaction.

Fields.Name: status
Fields.Description: AUTHORIZATION, MEMO, PENDING, or POSTED

Fields.Name: sub_category
Fields.Description: Transaction category detail

Fields.Name: transaction_id
Fields.Description:
Long term persistent identity of the transaction (unique to account). 
Transaction IDs should: 

  1. be the same for pending and posted 
  2. be different for reversed transactions 
  3. `referenceTransactionId` should be present for reversed transactions'

Fields.Name: transaction_timestamp
Fields.Description:
The date and time that the transaction was added to the server backend systems.

Akoya ensures that this field is populated for all transactions to which it applies, otherwise it is null. Either way it is always present.

Fields.Name: payment_details
Fields.Description: Payment details for some transactions

Fields.Name: transaction_type
Fields.Description: LoanTransaction Type

Fields.Name: corrected
Fields.Description: True to indicate this is a corrected tax form

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent identity of the source account. Not the account number

Fields.Name: tax_form_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent id for this tax form. Depending upon the data provider, this may be the same id as the enclosing tax statement id, or this may be a different id, or this id may be omitted.

Fields.Name: tax_form_date
Fields.Description: Date of production or delivery of the tax form

Fields.Name: additional_information
Fields.Description: Additional explanation text or content about this tax form

Fields.Name: tax_form_type
Fields.Description: Enumerated name of the tax form entity e.g. "TaxW2"

Fields.Name: issuer
Fields.Description: Issuer's name, address, phone, and TIN. Issuer data need only be transmitted on enclosing TaxStatement, if it is the same on all its included tax forms.

Fields.Name: recipient
Fields.Description: Recipient's name, address, phone, and TIN. Recipient data need only be transmitted on enclosing TaxStatement, if it is the same on all its included tax forms.

Fields.Name: attributes
Fields.Description: Additional attributes for this tax form when defined fields are not available. Some specific additional attributes already defined by providers: Fields required by [IRS FIRE](https://www.irs.gov/e-file-providers/filing-information-returns-electronically-fire): Name Control, Type of Identification Number (EIN, SSN, ITIN, ATIN). (ATIN is tax ID number for pending adoptions.) Tax form provider field for taxpayer notification: Recipient Email Address.

Fields.Name: error
Fields.Description: Present if an error was encountered while retrieving this form

Fields.Name: links
Fields.Description: Links to retrieve this form as data or image, or to invoke other APIs

Nodes.Title: Tax Data
Nodes.Name: TaxData
Nodes.Description:
Tax data container for API requests and responses

*This model accepts additional fields of type Any.*

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Corresponds to AccountId in Account

Fields.Name: amount
Fields.Description:
The amount of money in the account currency.

If balanceType is `ASSET`:

  1. If `debitCreditMemo` = `DEBIT`, sign is "+" or not present
  2. If `CREDIT`, sign is "-"

If balanceType is `LIABILITY`:

  1. If `debitCreditMemo` = `DEBIT`, sign is "-"
  2. If `CREDIT`, sign is "+" or not present

Fields.Name: category
Fields.Description: Transaction category, preferably MCC or SIC.

Fields.Name: debit_credit_memo
Fields.Description: Akoya will ensure that this is correctly populated with one of DEBIT or CREDIT and matches the sign of the status field.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: The description of the transaction

Fields.Name: image_ids
Fields.Description: Array of image identifiers (unique to transaction) used to retrieve images of check or transaction receipt.

Fields.Name: fi_attributes
Fields.Description:
Array of FI-specific attributes

**Constraints**: *Minimum Items*: `1`, *Unique Items Required*

Fields.Name: foreign_amount
Fields.Description: The amount of money in the foreign currency

Fields.Name: foreign_currency
Fields.Description: The ISO 4217 code of the foreign currency

Fields.Name: line_item
Fields.Description: Breakdown of the transaction details

Fields.Name: links
Fields.Description: Links (unique to this Transaction) used to retrieve images of checks or transaction receipts, or invoke other APIs

Fields.Name: memo
Fields.Description: Secondary transaction description

Fields.Name: posted_timestamp
Fields.Description: The date and time that the transaction was posted to the account. If not provided then TransactionTimestamp can be used as PostedTimeStamp.

Fields.Name: reference
Fields.Description: A tracking reference identifier

Fields.Name: reference_transaction_id
Fields.Description:
Akoya ensures that this field is populated for all transactions which are reversals, otherwise it is null. Either way it is always present.

For reverse postings, the identity of the transaction being reversed. For the correction transaction, the identity of the reversing post. For credit card posting transactions, the identity of the authorization transaction.

Fields.Name: status
Fields.Description: AUTHORIZATION, MEMO, PENDING, or POSTED

Fields.Name: sub_category
Fields.Description: Transaction category detail

Fields.Name: transaction_id
Fields.Description:
Long term persistent identity of the transaction (unique to account). 
Transaction IDs should: 

  1. be the same for pending and posted 
  2. be different for reversed transactions 
  3. `referenceTransactionId` should be present for reversed transactions'

Fields.Name: transaction_timestamp
Fields.Description:
The date and time that the transaction was added to the server backend systems.

Akoya ensures that this field is populated for all transactions to which it applies, otherwise it is null. Either way it is always present.

Nodes.Name: TransactionsEntity

Fields.Name: tax_year
Fields.Description:
Year for which taxes are being paid

**Constraints**: `>= 2018`, `<= 2050`

Fields.Name: corrected
Fields.Description: True to indicate this is a corrected tax form

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent identity of the source account. Not the account number

Fields.Name: tax_form_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent id for this tax form. Depending upon the data provider, this may be the same id as the enclosing tax statement id, or this may be a different id, or this id may be omitted.

Fields.Name: tax_form_date
Fields.Description: Date of production or delivery of the tax form

Fields.Name: additional_information
Fields.Description: Additional explanation text or content about this tax form

Fields.Name: tax_form_type
Fields.Description: Enumerated name of the tax form entity e.g. "TaxW2"

Fields.Name: issuer
Fields.Description: Issuer's name, address, phone, and TIN. Issuer data need only be transmitted on enclosing TaxStatement, if it is the same on all its included tax forms.

Fields.Name: recipient
Fields.Description: Recipient's name, address, phone, and TIN. Recipient data need only be transmitted on enclosing TaxStatement, if it is the same on all its included tax forms.

Fields.Name: attributes
Fields.Description: Additional attributes for this tax form when defined fields are not available. Some specific additional attributes already defined by providers: Fields required by [IRS FIRE](https://www.irs.gov/e-file-providers/filing-information-returns-electronically-fire): Name Control, Type of Identification Number (EIN, SSN, ITIN, ATIN). (ATIN is tax ID number for pending adoptions.) Tax form provider field for taxpayer notification: Recipient Email Address.

Fields.Name: error
Fields.Description: Present if an error was encountered while retrieving this form

Fields.Name: links
Fields.Description: Links to retrieve this form as data or image, or to invoke other APIs

Fields.Name: corrected
Fields.Description: True to indicate this is a corrected tax form

Fields.Name: account_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent identity of the source account. Not the account number

Fields.Name: tax_form_id
Fields.Description: Long-term persistent id for this tax form. Depending upon the data provider, this may be the same id as the enclosing tax statement id, or this may be a different id, or this id may be omitted.

Fields.Name: tax_form_date
Fields.Description: Date of production or delivery of the tax form

Fields.Name: additional_information
Fields.Description: Additional explanation text or content about this tax form

Fields.Name: tax_form_type
Fields.Description: Enumerated name of the tax form entity e.g. "TaxW2"

Fields.Name: issuer
Fields.Description: Issuer's name, address, phone, and TIN. Issuer data need only be transmitted on enclosing TaxStatement, if it is the same on all its included tax forms.

Fields.Name: recipient
Fields.Description: Recipient's name, address, phone, and TIN. Recipient data need only be transmitted on enclosing TaxStatement, if it is the same on all its included tax forms.

Fields.Name: attributes
Fields.Description: Additional attributes for this tax form when defined fields are not available. Some specific additional attributes already defined by providers: Fields required by [IRS FIRE](https://www.irs.gov/e-file-providers/filing-information-returns-electronically-fire): Name Control, Type of Identification Number (EIN, SSN, ITIN, ATIN). (ATIN is tax ID number for pending adoptions.) Tax form provider field for taxpayer notification: Recipient Email Address.

Fields.Description: Present if an error was encountered while retrieving this form

Fields.Name: links
Fields.Description: Links to retrieve this form as data or image, or to invoke other APIs

Fields.Description: The list of cryptocurrency gains and losses

Some specific additional attributes already defined by providers: Fields required by [IRS FIRE](https://www.irs.gov/e-file-providers/filing-information-returns-electronically-fire): Name Control, Type of Identification Number (EIN, SSN, ITIN, ATIN). (ATIN is tax ID number for pending adoptions.) Tax form provider field for taxpayer notification: Recipient Email Address.

Fields.Description: The list of data contents for all included tax forms, response should include one of `forms` or `pdf`

Fields.Name: pdf
Fields.Description: PDF version of the tax statement containing all form pages, binary encoded as Base64, response should include one of `pdf` or `forms`

Fields.Name: attributes
Fields.Description: Additional tax statement attributes that the provider wishes to include

Nodes.Title: State Code
Nodes.Name: StateCode
Nodes.Description:
The codes for U.S. states, possessions and military overseas addresses. From [USPS Publication 28 - Postal Addressing Standards](https://pe.usps.com/text/pub28/28apb.htm) and [IRS Zip Code and State Abbreviations](https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-utl/zip_code_and_state_abbreviations.pdf). Includes codes for 50 states and District of Columbia plus:
  * AA - Armed Forces Americas (except Canada)
  * AE - Armed Forces Europe, Africa, the Middle East, and Canada
  * AP - Armed Forces Pacific
  * AS - American Samoa
  * FM - Federated States of Micronesia
  * GU - Guam
  * MH - Marshall Islands
  * MP - Northern Mariana Islands
  * PR - Puerto Rico
  * PW - Palau
  * VI - U.S. Virgin Islands

Fields.Name: code
Fields.Description: Error code defined by FDX API Specification or Data Provider indicating the error situation which has occurred

Fields.Name: message
Fields.Description: End user displayable information which might help the customer diagnose an error

Fields.Name: debug_message
Fields.Description: Message used to debug the root cause of the error. Contents should not be used in consumer's business logic. Can change at any time and should only be used for consumer to communicate with the data provider about an issue. Provider can include an error GUID in message for their use.

Nodes.Title: Error
Nodes.Name: ErrorException
Nodes.Description:
An error entity which can be used at the API level for error responses or at the account level to indicate a problem specific to a particular account. See the error codes and descriptions defined in the latest FDX API Specification document, section 6.2 Errors

*This model accepts additional fields of type Any.*

Fields.Name: error
Fields.Description: Gets or sets error code.

Fields.Name: error_description
Fields.Description:
Gets or sets human-readable text providing additional information on error.
Used to assist the client developer in understanding the error that occurred.

Fields.Name: error_uri
Fields.Description: Gets or sets a URI identifying a human-readable web page with information about the error, used to provide the client developer with additional information about the error.

Nodes.Title: OAuth Provider
Nodes.Name: OauthProviderException
Nodes.Description:
OAuth 2 Authorization endpoint exception.

*This model accepts additional fields of type Any.*

Nodes.Text: Represents the proxy server configurations for API calls.
Properties

Data: The port to connect to the proxy server.

CodeExamples.Title: Usage Example
CodeExamples.Text:
from akoyaapisv240.akoyaapisv_240_client import Akoyaapisv240Client
from akoyaapisv240.http.proxy_settings import ProxySettings

client = Akoyaapisv240Client(
    proxy_settings=ProxySettings(
        address='http://localhost',
        port=8888,
        username='user',
        password='pass'
     )
)

Nodes.Text: An abstract class for custom logger implementation.
Abstract Methods

Data: Logs a message with a specified log level and additional parameters.

1. level (int): The log level of the message.
2. message (str): The message template to log.
3. params: (Dict[str, Any]): The parameters to include in the log message.

Nodes.Text: Usage Example
Client Initialization with Custom Logger
In order to provide custom logger implementation, the `AbstractLogger` class must be inherited so that you can override the `log` behavior.
Following is how the custom logger implementation can be injected in the SDK client.
Represents the logging configuration for API calls.
Parameters

Data: Takes in your custom implementation of the abstract logger class here. **Default Implementation : `ConsoleLogger`**
Defines the log message severity mentioned in python logging module (e.g., DEBUG, INFO, WARN|WARNING, ERROR, FATAL|CRITICAL). **Default : `logging.INFO`**
Toggles the global setting to mask sensitive HTTP headers in both requests and responses before logging, safeguarding confidential data. **Default : `True`**
The logging configuration for an API request.
The logging configuration for an API response.

Nodes.Text: Represents the logging configuration for API request.
Parameters

Data: Toggles the logging of the request body. **Default : `False`**
Toggles the logging of the request headers. **Default : `False`**
Includes only specified request headers in the log output. **Default : `[]`**
Excludes specified request headers from the log output. **Default : `[]`**
Logs specified request headers without masking, revealing their actual values. **Default : `[]`**
Toggles the inclusion of query parameters in the logged request path. **Default : `False`**

Nodes.Text: Represents the logging configuration for API response.
Parameters

Data: Toggles the logging of the response body. **Default : `False`**
Toggles the logging of the response headers. **Default : `False`**
Includes only specified response headers in the log output. **Default : `[]`**
Excludes specified response headers from the log output. **Default : `[]`**
Logs specified response headers without masking, revealing their actual values. **Default : `[]`**

Nodes.Text: Http response received.
Parameters

Data: The status code returned by the server.
The reason phrase returned by the server.
The request that resulted in this response.

Nodes.Text: Represents a single Http Request.
Parameters

Data: The HTTP method of the request.
The endpoint URL for the API request.
Query parameters to add in the URL.
Request body, either as a serialized string or else a list of parameters to form encode.
Files to be sent with the request.

Nodes.Text: An object with the response value as well as other useful information such as status codes and headers.
Properties

Data: The HTTP status code of the response.
The reason phrase returned with the status code.
The raw response body as a string.
The parsed response data, if applicable.

CodeExamples.Title: Usage Example
CodeExamples.Text:
try:
    # Perform API request
    result: ApiResponse = client.example_controller.example_endpoint(input)

    # Inspect response attributes
    print("Status Code:", result.status_code)
    print("Headers:", result.headers)
    print("Body:", result.body)
except APIException as e:
    print("API Exception:", e)
except Exception as e:
    print("General Exception:", e)

Nodes.Text: An iterable wrapper for paginated data that allows iteration over pages or individual items. It can fetch and iterate over each individual element in all the pages lazily.
This class defines the '__iter__` method that provides it with the iterator functionality.
Methods

Data: Provides iterator functionality to sequentially access all items across all pages. It will loop through all items by fetching next pages lazily.
Retrieve an iterable collection of all pages in the paginated data, which can be used to loop through all pages lazily.
